page.title: 10 LANGUAGE
page.content: Spoken LANGUAGUE tends to be rather lazy and slovenly. The following examples of written work show the influence of speech. I seen it. He done it. I should of gone to the shops. She could of climbed the mountain. Gonna going to. Gorra get to. The youngest child is invariably known as bab. A typical conjugation would be: I ain't got no sweets. You ain't got no sweets. He ain't got no sweets. We ain't got no sweets. You ain't got no sweets They ain't got no sweets. One might be tempted to ask, "Wno has got all the sweets!"
